In the Upper Midwest, particularly Wisconsin, burgers are often made with a buttered bun.
Style of hamburger in which the bun is a compressed cake of rice.
Fishcake made mostly from salmon in the style of a hamburger.
Hamburger or cheeseburger prepared with one or more glazed doughnuts in place of the bun.
Typically prepared with ground, sliced or minced beefsteak meat. Additional meats are also used.
made from pounded rice filled with ice cream.
Philadelphia ice cream is churned with more air than its denser counterparts and has a fluffier texture.
Sherbet is a fruit-based frozen dessert that contains dairy and no more than three percent milk fat.
Falooda is an Indian version of a cold dessert that has its origin in Persian cuisine.
It is made using milk, sugar, cream, and other ingredients that are stirred to take in air and at the same time cooled.
Sugar water, mung beans, and condensed milk are commonly used as toppings for baobing.
kulfi is made by slowly heating milk with spices, sugar, and nuts while constantly stirring.
made with milk and sugar, and it typically doesn’t contain eggs.
